body_html:
I decided to pull your repo into a clean directory and open a new x64 Native Tools VS 2017 console and run:
set MAGMA_HOME=C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\magma_cuda90_release
(the prior location of where I put the magma files)
cuda90.bat
call C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3\Scripts\activate C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3
cuda90.bat

and it seems to be building now, but it failed to find my MKL installation, and it also failed to find my ACML installation.
It did mention that I'm missing BLAS, LAPACK, and NNPACK.

Do these libraries have a substantial impact on performance?

body:
I decided to pull your repo into a clean directory and open a new x64 Native Tools VS 2017 console and run:
`set MAGMA_HOME=C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\magma_cuda90_release`
(the prior location of where I put the magma files)
`cuda90.bat`
`call C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3\Scripts\activate C:\src\magma_cuda90\pytorch\Miniconda3`
`cuda90.bat`

and it seems to be building now, but it failed to find my MKL installation, and it also failed to find my ACML installation. 
It did mention that I'm missing BLAS, LAPACK, and NNPACK. 

Do these libraries have a substantial impact on performance?
